cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the central Caribbean, forecast to slow, turn northwest across Cuba, then pass through the Florida Straits and into the eastern Gulf while approaching the Florida peninsula

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula (including southeast coast), Cuba, Jamaica, Hispaniola
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible late Mon–Tue with 23 % cumulative chance
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Atlantic side of southeast Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with isolated totals near 6 inches early next week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas, dangerous rip currents, brief squalls reducing visibility
